OptionDisplayGroup.name: groupRealisticMinningVanilla
OptionDisplayGroup.Description: Distribution options for Realistic Minning Vanilla Ores.

OptionChoice.name: enableRealisticMinningVanilla
OptionChoice.Description: Should Custom Ore Generation handle Realistic Minning Vanilla ore generation?

Choice.description: Use Custom Ore Generation to handle Realistic Minning Vanilla ores.
Realistic Minning Vanilla ores will be handled by Minecraft directly.

OptionChoice.name: cleanUpRealisticMinningVanilla
OptionChoice.Description: Should Custom Ore Generation use the Substitution Pass to remove all instances of Realistic Minning Vanilla ore from the world? If the mod's oregen can be turned off in its configuration, then it's recommended to do so, as the substitution pass can slow the game significantly. If this option is disabled without disabling the mod's own ore generation, you'll end up with two oregens working at once, flooding the world with ore. Enabled by default to ensure the ores are completely removed.

Choice.description: Use the substitution pass to clean up Realistic Minning Vanilla ores.
Realistic Minning Vanilla ores do not need to be cleaned up by a substitution pass.

Choice.Description: Small motherlodes without any branches.

Choice.description: Clay is not generated in the world.

OptionNumeric.name: vnlaClayFreq
OptionNumeric.Description: Frequency multiplier for Realistic Minning Vanilla Clay distributions

OptionNumeric.name: vnlaClaySize
OptionNumeric.Description: Size multiplier for Realistic Minning Vanilla Clay distributions

Choice.Description: Very large, extremely rare motherlodes with long, thin tendrils.
Large irregular clouds filled lightly with ore.
Simulates Vanilla Minecraft.

Choice.description: Iron is not generated in the world.

OptionNumeric.name: vnlaIronFreq
OptionNumeric.Description: Frequency multiplier for Realistic Minning Vanilla Iron distributions

OptionNumeric.name: vnlaIronSize
OptionNumeric.Description: Size multiplier for Realistic Minning Vanilla Iron distributions

Substitute.name: vnlaOverworldBlockSubstitute2
Substitute.Comment: The global option deferredPopulationRange must be large enough to catch all ore clusters (>= 32).

Substitute.name: vnlaOverworldBlockSubstitute3
Substitute.Comment: The global option deferredPopulationRange must be large enough to catch all ore clusters (>= 32).

Veins.name: vnlaClayVeins
Veins.Description: Small motherlodes without any branches. Similar to the deposits produced by StandardGen distributions.

Veins.name: vnlaClayPreferredVeins
Veins.Description: Ore generation is doubled in preferred biomes.

Veins.name: vnlaIronVeins
Veins.Description: Very large, extremely rare motherlodes. Each motherlode has many long slender branches---so thin that parts of the branch won't contain any ore at all. This, combined with the incredible length of the branches, makes them more challenging to follow underground. Once found, however, a motherlode contains enough ore to keep a player supplied for a very long time. The rarity of these veins might be too frustrating in a single-player setting. In SMP, though, teamwork could make finding them much easier and the motherlodes are big enough to supply several people without shortage. This might be a good way to add challenge to multiplayer worlds. Credit: based on feedback by dyrewulf from the MC forums.

Cloud.name: vnlaIronCloud
Cloud.Description: Large irregular clouds filled lightly with ore. These are huge, spanning several adjacent chunks, and consequently rather rare. They contain a sizeable amount of ore, but it takes some time and effort to mine due to low density. The intent for strategic clouds is that the player will need to actively search for one and then set up a semi-permanent mining base and spend some time actually mining the ore.

Veins.name: vnlaIronHintVeins
Veins.Description: Single blocks, generously scattered through all heights (density is about that of vanilla iron ore). They will replace dirt and sandstone (but not grass or sand), so they can be found nearer to the surface than most ores. Intened to be used as a child distribution for large, rare strategic deposits that would otherwise be very difficult to find. Note that the frequency is multiplied by ground level to maintain a constant density, but not by ore frequency because it is assumed that the frequency of the parent distribution will already be scaled by that.

StandardGen.name: vnlaIronStandard
StandardGen.Description: A master preset for standardgen ore distributions.
